alert.note: Alert for Camp; Cass; Gregg; Harrison; Marion; Morris; Rusk; Smith; Upshur; Wood (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 3:14AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CADDO PARISH... CENTRAL SMITH...MARION...SOUTHERN CASS...NORTHWESTERN HARRISON... NORTHWESTERN RUSK...SOUTHEASTERN WOOD...UPSHUR...SOUTHERN MORRIS... SOUTHEASTERN CAMP AND GREGG COUNTIES THROUGH 400 AM CST... At 313 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Linden to Harleton to near Big Sandy to near Tyler. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Longview, Kilgore, Whitehouse, White Oak, Gladewater, Gilmer, Vivian, Hallsville, Overton, Jefferson, Linden, Hughes Springs, Lone Star, Big Sandy, Hawkins, Ore City, New London, Clarksville City, and East Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for northwestern Louisiana...and northeastern Texas.
